all_questions.question: When can opposition parties submit a proposal?
What is the purpose of submitting a proposal to the Constitutional Court?
all_questions.context: Opposition parties can submit a proposal from March 20, when the amendment was published in the Collection of Laws.

all_questions.question: What happens if the constitutional order has been violated?
all_questions.context: If the constitutional order has been violated, the court may annul the law in question and order the relevant state authority to restore the status quo prior to the violation of the Constitution.

all_questions.question: What is an obiter dictum?
all_questions.context: obiter dictum, which is a non-authoritative statement beyond the basic reasoning ( .pdf, p. 11).

all_questions.question: Why was there a case law about extending the state of emergency?
all_questions.context: Marian Jurečka mentions the case law when the Constitutional Court found doubts in the manner extension of the state of emergency.

all_questions.question: What is the significance of the Constitutional Court's decision on the amendment?
all_questions.context: The Constitutional Court will then decide whether the law or its individual provisions are in conflict with the constitution.

all_questions.question: Can the Constitutional Court decide on a proposal to cancel the extension of a state of emergency?
all_questions.context: The Constitutional Court rejected the proposal (.pdf, p. 1), stating that it is not within its competence to decide on such a proposal (.pdf, p. 7. 12).
